item.title: Vatican II: Non-Catholics Can Receive Communion
item.description: Source: vaticancatholic.com Pope Pius VIII, Traditi Humilitati (# 4), May 24, 1829: “Jerome used to say it this way: he who eats the Lamb outside this house will perish as did those during the flood who were not with Noah in the ark.”[1] Benedict XVI giving Communion to the public heretic, Bro. Roger Schutz, the Protestant founder of Taize on April 8, 2005 In the preceding sections on the heresies of Vatican II and John Paul II, we covered that they both teach the heresy that non-Catholics may lawfully receive Holy Communion.

item.title: Debate: does Vatican II teach that non-Catholics may lawfully receive Holy Communion?
